result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Scott William Dummert was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

State rests.  Atty Zamzow has no witnesses.

Judge Moran and reporter appear by phone from Marathon County Courthouse.
Defendant Scott William Dummert by phone with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow who appears by phone as well.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions counsel.  Atty Hendee makes statement.  Believes there is a request that the order for conditional release be revoked.  Atty Zamzow requests the conditional release go forward and a plan be put in place.  Court questions Atty Zamzow.

Judge Moran and reporter appear by phone from Marathon County.
Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also appearing by phone are Shannon Stydahar-Schulz and Matt Ziegler.
Atty Hendee states transport has not happened as there are no beds available at Mendota.  States there is a petition to revoke the conditional release.  Atty Klopp responds.  Objects to the revocation of the conditional release and moves to sequester witnesses.  BY THE COURT:  Witnesses sequestered at this time.
Shannon Stydahar-Schulz called and sworn. Examined by Atty Hendee. Cross-examined by Atty Klopp. Re-direct by Atty Hendee. 
Matthew Ziegler called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee. Cross-examined by Atty Klopp. 
Atty Hendee makes final statement.  Atty Klopp makes final statement.  Final statement by Atty Hendee.
BY THE COURT:  Court will revoke the conditional release at this time and defendant is to be confined to Mendota Mental Health.  Matter will be reviewed according to statutes.  Pending bed availability, defendant shall be transported back to and housed in Waukesha County Jail.
to Court from Jim and Sherry Dummert
Statement of Probable Cause for Detention and Petition for Revocation of Conditional Release
Ct Atty Atty Fee billing statement - Approved s/MM/7-20-16
to Court from Agent Shannon Stydahar (confidential - for parties only)

Judge Moran and reporter appear by phone from Marathon County.
Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee makes statement.  Atty Klopp responds.  
Matt Ziegler now appears by phone.  Court questions Mr. Ziegler.  Mr. Ziegler states he has prepare the conditional release plan as ordered but is not confident defendant will be successful on conditional release.  Requests the order for conditional release plan be revoked and have defendant tranferred to Mendota Mental Health for a period of time.  Atty Klopp questions Mr. Ziegler.  Court questions Mr. Ziegler.  
Atty Hendee makes argument.
BY THE COURT:  Court will adopt the Conditional Release Plan.  
10:51am  Recess for 5 minutes.
10:56am  Court in session.
Atty Hendee has no further statements.  
BY THE COURT:  Court states it adopts the Conditional Release Plan with some trepidation.  Court is hopeful that defendant will get medications right away.  Court will not hesitate whatsoever to revoke if the plan is not complied with.
for Involuntary Medication and Treatment s/MKM/5-16-16
Correspondence to Court from Jim & Sherry Dummert (5 letters)

Judge Moran and court reporter appear by phone from Marathon County.
Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states this matter is set to determine a conditional release plan.  Parties do not have an agreement at this time.
Matthew Ziegler called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Hendee.  Cross-examined by Atty Klopp.  Court states he received some previous correspondence from the defendant's parents.  He will fax that information now since none of the parties received that information.  Clerk will make copies for counsel.  Atty Klopp continues cross-examination of the witness.  Re-direct by Atty Hendee.  
State rests.  Defense has no witnesses.
10:09am  Recess.  10:25am  Court in session.
Counsel have both reviewed the documents sent by the Court and they will be filed.  
Court questions Mr. Ziegler.  
Atty Hendee makes recommendations.  Atty Klopp makes recommendations.  
BY THE COURT:  Court cannot find that release would pose a significant risk to either the defendant or the public.  Court orders a Conditional Release Plan be completed.  Court finds defendant is not competent to refuse medication.  He is to immediately be given involuntary medications.  Court wants the plan to include that any use of any type of illicit drugs or alcohol would result in immediate revocation of the conditional release.  Conditional Discharge plan is ordered.  Court will prepare and send to clerk for processing.

Judge Moran and court reporter appear by phone from Marathon County Courthouse.
Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Transcript of November 24, 2015 plea & dispo - Karen Blair, reporter
Order Vacating Order for Conditional Release Plan s/MKM/1-21-16

Judge Moran and court reporter appear by phone from Marathon County Courthouse.
Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle who appears by phone.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states issues before the Court.  Atty Boyle states he received discipline and will not be able to continue if this matter proceeds after today (until March).  Would request the Court be allowed to withdraw if this will continue.  
BY THE COURT:  Court orders an additional examination and supplement report.
Mr. Dummert makes statement to the Court.  Court responds.  
Court believes additional information is needed.
Matt Ziegler (report provider) called.  Court questions Mr. Ziegler.  Mr. Ziegler responds.  Recommends a Predisposition Investigation.  Mr. Dummert responds and objects as he thought he'd be released today.  Atty Boyle responds and believes Mr. Dummert should be appointed another lawyer from the Public Defender's Office.
BY THE COURT:  Court will order a Pre-dipositional Investigation to be done.   Court will allow Atty Boyle to withdraw and Mr. Dummert may either hire other counsel or apply for public defender appointment.
Mr. Dummert responds.  Atty Hendee makes statement.  Mr. Ziegler states he should be able to have his report done within the next 3 weeks.
BY THE COURT:  Court will schedule this matter as soon as a new defense attorney is on board.  Mr. Zieger is to start on his report as of today as the order will be a while in being completed (waiting to see who is appointed from Public Defender's Office)

Also heard with Waushara County Case 15CF17
Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Parties stipulate that defendant will enter a plea to Marquette County Case 15CF2 and Court will find Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.  Defendant will also enter plea to both counts in the Waushara County Case 15CF2 with a 60 month DPA being entered.  Atty Boyle agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Boyle.  Defendant enters Guilty plea to Marquette County case 15CF2.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea to both counts in Waushara County case 15CF17.  
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea of Marquette County case 15CF2.  Court finds defendant Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect.  
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the defendants plea in Waushara County case 15CF17 and approves the 60 month DPA signed by all parties.

BY THE COURT:  15CF2:  Court orders defendant confined for a period of 3 years.  Granted credit for 309 days already served (not including today).  Court requests a conditional release plan be prepared to see if he can be released into the community.  

Atty Boyle authorizes the release of Dr. Berney's report to the person preparing the conditional release plan.

Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Defendant Scott William Dummert in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF17 Waushara County case tracking:
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of Dr. Bernies evaluation.  Atty Boyle accepts the report.  Court states that this is not a competency hearing just a status.
Atty Hendee agrees and states that Dr. Bernie made a finding the NGI for the  Marquette County case but not Waushara County case.  Atty Hendee states that parties are in agreement with the NGI on the Marquette County case.  Atty Hendee feels that for the Waushara County case; the parties are asking for it to be continued.
Atty Boyle agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Plea for Marquette County case to be set.
Court will appear in person in Marquette County.
Set Status for Waushara County case for same day and additional scheduling will be done that day.



  Plea hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gerald Philip Boyle appeared by phone means for Defendant Scott William Dummert. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott William Dummert in Custody.
Waushara County case #15CF17 & Marquette County case #15CF2:
Atty Boyle states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary Hearing on both cases today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.  Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information in both matters with the Court.  Atty Boyle states that he has not seen the information due to him out of the office at this time.  Atty Boyle states that if the court reads the charges on the information he will be ok with proceeding today.
Defendant enters a NGI plea.  Atty Boyle agrees with the NGI plea made by the defendant.

BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the NGI plea on both matters.
Jury is demanded in all three counts per Atty Boyle's request.
Bond continued.

Atty Hendee asks the court to allow him to have a conversation with Atty Boyle to come up with a person for the evaluation.
Court agrees with that and once that is established; parties are to contact the court with the name.
Atty Hendees states that a waiver of prelim form has been completed by Atty Boyle and the defendant and gives it to the clerk.
WAIVER OF RIGHT TO PRELIMINARY HEARING

Defendant Scott William Dummert in court with attorney Gerald Philip Boyle.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Moran & Court reporter appeared telephonically. D.A. gave appearances. All parties received competency evaluation. Atty Hendee requested pre-lim be set. Court asked if all parties agree with finding of competent to proceed. Atty Boyle not contesting Finding of Competent. 
Based on all parties agreeing to finding, Court finds defendant competent to proceed. Defendant requests bond be addressed. Defendant made statement regarding bond, Court denies request. Bond to continue. Attorneys to call Judge Moran's office after 1:30 to schedule pre-liminary hearing.
Atty Boyle waives time limits to hold pre-lim.

Atty Boyle requests competency examination.  No objection by Atty Hendee.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds cause and will order a Competency Examination.  
Court states his JA will contact counsel to schedule a future hearing.
